subject: Negotiation
title: The Munich Olympics Massacre
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Munich Olympics Massacre.

hook.text: At the 1972 Olympics, 11 Israeli athletes were taken hostage. Every rescue attempt failed. All 11 died.

buildup.text: Palestinian militants seized Israeli team members in the Olympic Village. Germany had no crisis negotiation teams.

discovery.text: A botched rescue at the airport failed because snipers were poorly positioned and communication broke down.

twist.text: The tragedy created modern crisis negotiation. The FBI founded its Crisis Negotiation Unit as a direct result.

climax.text: Munich proved that improvised responses to crises are almost always worse than trained, practiced ones.

punchline.text: From the worst failure came the systems that save lives today.

quiz.question: What lasting change resulted from the Munich Olympics tragedy?
options: It led to the creation of modern crisis negotiation units worldwide
Security at sporting events was eliminated
